item.title: Wattio
item.description:
Wattio

The device works very nicely even if the translation (from Spanish to English) is far from being perfect. I use it to remotely control my warming system. On top of that the guys from Wattio are really nice. I met one in Vienna at Pioneers 2014. And they replaced my Thermic that had a minor display issue without hesitation.

item.title: Robo 3D
item.description:
Robo 3D

Wonderful. It prints great pieces. This was a gift to my wife who holds a master degree in chemical engineering and specialised in polymers. The plan was, and still is, to develop a business of 3D printing and scanning (see below).

item.title: ISSA
item.description:
ISSA

I’m not really fan of teeth brushing. This new type of toothbrush makes it different. Yeah it does look like a sextoy but it isn’t. It gently brushes my teeth that are clean as new.

item.title: ERI
item.description:
ERI

The final design of the devices is much less nice than expected. But it does the job so far. It might need some further calibration as it doesn’t account for the same number of steps as Moves. That said, I don’t know which one is the most accurate.

item.title: Structure Sensor
item.description:
Structure Sensor

The device works very nicely even if the apps could be improved further. It complement very nicely the 3D printer to be able to scan “portraits” and pieces.

item.title: Matter and Form
item.description:
Matter and Form

I bought this to combine it with my Robo 3D. Unfortunately, it doesn't work as smoothly as expected. I never managed to get high quality scans despite many efforts. The Mac software came very late (from my perspective).

item.title: ODBLink MX Wi-Fi
item.description:
ODBLink MX Wi-Fi

The goal was to monitor much more closely the performances of my cars. It works very nicely. You can get the full diagnostic at any moment and much more in real time.

item.title: AnyMote Home
item.description:
AnyMote Home

It took so much time to get it that I finally bought a MyHarmony set from Logitech, which works almost perfectly and delivers exactly the same services. I still must try the AnyMote Home to be honest.
